description: From Middle English lothsomnesse, loþsumnes, lathsumnes; equivalent to loathsome +‎ -ness.

entries.meaning: (uncountable) The nature or property that gives rise to revulsion or inspires loathing.

examples: After it raced the naked, tittering, phosphorescent thing that belonged on the carven pedestal, and still farther behind panted the dark men, and all the dread crew of sentient loathsomenesses. The corpse was gaining on its pursuers [...]
